ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] hey ppl read this  if intrested in equestrielle
ygData.msgSnippet: Thank you Lori. I appreciate you using full word spelling. For some reason the abbreviations annoy the hell out of some people. I can stand it to some extent
ygData.messageBody:
Thank you Lori. I appreciate you using full word spelling. For some reason
the abbreviations annoy the hell out of some people. I can stand it to some
extent but sometimes it annoys me. :-)
I do use some abbreviations like bc when typing, but try not to have every
word in a sentence abbreviated. Well, it works in groups when you have to
type really fast. :-)
Cool. I vaguely remember 9th grade. It sucked. lol.
I bet it's fun being on summer vacation. :-)
What server do you play on?
luv,
-Su

> Ok then you all want me to type with good grammer ok I will do
so.......while i am typeing email's to you all at least. But my friends have
probably gotten used to me typeing that way so i am going to keep typeing on
eq. But ok see .......am I typeing ok so far?? any way, I just think it is
easier and faster so people dont have to wait forever to hear a response
when they want it and especially while they are excited...am I correct? I am
14 years old and going on 9th grade, k-6 is elementry for me and 7 and 8 are
middle school and 9-12 is high school..........so I have been going to
school around 10 or 11 years, my mom put me in school when I was 5 years
old. Ok is everything all cleared up and all or does some one else have a
problem or challenge for me?
> c ya l8er......oops i mean see you all later-----lori
>
> Wulfric Rennison <wulftech@...> wrote:
> I thought this was kind of funny actually. I don't recall ever taking
spelling after the elementary school levels. From Grades 9 - 12 they
assumed that if we made it that far then we already knew how to spell. So
if this person is still in that phase of his/her life where Spelling is a
major subject of study then I could believe "whole life" could equal 10
years!
>
> I agree with Jerry, though, who stated in another email that if you do
that by habit, then you'll find yourself doing it when you shouldn't. It's
best to learn proper spelling and grammar skills first and make them a
habit. Then you can use your internet-ese for fun. Worst thing you could
do is turn in a research paper for your professor that's full of
abbreviations and misspellings, or perhaps be making a big presentation at
work and have that kind of spelling and grammar. Nobody would take you
seriously.
>
> There are a few reasons why people type like that: 1. Because they don't
know how to type properly so they can't keep up with how fast the internet
chat room is moving, 2. Because they really don't know how to spell or how
to use proper grammar, and/or 3. They think it's cool when it's really not.
Which one are you?
>
>
> You learned to spell for a reason. You say you're good at it. So use it.
>
> Wulfric
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----

> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com

> What was your grade in reading comprehension? I was saying that you could

> I had assumed you were doing it to make fun of people who type like that.
> :-)
> If I were a mean person I'd ask if your whole life was 10 years. ;-D
> luv,
> -Su
